title: Scoring Animation with Boost Breakdown

title: Design Decision: Shop-Only Boost Swapping
description: Boosts can ONLY be swapped/discarded in the shop, not during gameplay. Rationale: (1) Simpler mental model - boosts locked in for the round, (2) Avoids edge cases like 'extra rack' boost removal mid-turn forcing tile discard, (3) Strategic decisions happen at natural break points. Unlike Balatro which allows selling jokers anytime, word game pacing benefits from shop-contained decisions.
closedReason: Design decision documented

title: Balatro Gap Analysis Interview
description: Deep-dive interview process to fill gaps identified in Balatro analysis. Document: docs/plans/2026-01-18-balatro-analysis.md covers 8 areas. WORKFLOW: Read the analysis doc section, interview user using AskUserQuestion about gaps/suggestions/open questions, then create actionable child beads.
notes: Interview prompt: 'Read docs/plans/2026-01-18-balatro-analysis.md section [N] and interview me in detail using AskUserQuestion - technical implementation, UI/UX, concerns, tradeoffs. Be in-depth with non-obvious questions. Continue until complete, then create beads from findings.'

title: Interview: Combo Discovery & Synergy
description: Section 1 of Balatro analysis. GAP: Boosts are independent, no emergent combos. SUGGESTIONS: Synergy boosts, conditional triggers, multiplicative effects, copy/mirror boosts. OPEN QUESTIONS: How many synergies? Obvious or discoverable? Power ceiling?

title: Interview: Risk/Reward Tension
description: Section 2 of Balatro analysis. GAP: Safe gameplay, no gambling moments. SUGGESTIONS: Blindfold boost, Double or Nothing, Skip Shop gamble, All-in turn, Glass tiles. OPEN QUESTIONS: How punishing? Opt-in or forced? Frequency per run?

title: Interview: Build Diversity
description: Section 3 of Balatro analysis. GAP: One strategy (make good words), every run plays similarly. SUGGESTIONS: Vowel Build, Length Build, Bonus Square Build, Economy Build, Placement Build, Letter Build, Blitz Build. OPEN QUESTIONS: How many archetypes? Mutually exclusive or combinable? How to guide discovery?

title: Interview: Scoring Drama
description: Section 4 of Balatro analysis. GAP: Score appears instantly, no buildup or drama. SUGGESTIONS: Animate boost contributions, speed up with more boosts, sound effects, screen shake. OPEN QUESTIONS: Animation duration? Skippable? Visual style? See also rl-22.

title: Interview: Meaningful Tile Identity
description: Section 5 of Balatro analysis. GAP: Tiles are just letters with occasional +1 buff, no personality. SUGGESTIONS: Gold/Glass/Steel/Lucky/Mult/Retrigger/Polychrome/Foil tiles. OPEN QUESTIONS: How acquired? How many per run? Upgrade paths? See also rl-11.

title: Interview: Boss Tension
description: Section 6 of Balatro analysis. GAP: Boss rounds in spec but not implemented, no anticipation. SUGGESTIONS: Show boss at set start, specific boss effects (Vowel Tax, Short Fuse, Hoarder, etc.), counter-boosts in shop. OPEN QUESTIONS: Fixed or random bosses? Difficulty? Counter-boost availability? See also rl-10.

title: Interview: Discovery & Unlocks
description: Section 7 of Balatro analysis. GAP: All boosts available immediately, no discovery or long-term goals. SUGGESTIONS: Achievement-based unlock conditions, mid-run notifications, Gem Shop shows locked items. OPEN QUESTIONS: % locked at start? Progress persist across runs? Visibility of conditions? See also rl-17.

title: Interview: One More Run Loop
description: Section 8 of Balatro analysis. STATUS: Already good - run length is appropriate. SUGGESTIONS: Ensure variety through randomization, end-of-run summary (rl-19), endless mode, daily challenges. OPEN QUESTIONS: Optimal run length? Shorter/longer options? Ensuring run variety?

title: Boost Visual Identity & Personality
description: DESIGN DIRECTION: Tiles are like Balatro cards (mild visual changes - colors, markings, borders for effects). Boosts are like jokers (more personality, unique identity). DON'T copy jokers exactly - should fit RogueLetters' roguelike word-game aesthetic. Boosts need distinctive art/icons, names with character, maybe animations. This is where personality and 'fun factor' live. Future polish task.
notes: Tiles = subtle variations. Boosts = bold personality. Find a visual language that's uniquely RogueLetters. See also rl-34 for naming.

title: Rename Boosts to 'Rogues'
description: APPROVED: Rename 'boosts' to 'Rogues' throughout the game. TERMINOLOGY: (1) 'Rogues' = the powerups (formerly boosts), (2) 'Rogues' Gallery' = the selected rogues currently in play (sidebar display). SYSTEM RULES: (1) Max 5 rogues at a time, (2) Must discard to buy new one (no refund), (3) Discarded rogues immediately return to pool, (4) Show all shop options - buying at max triggers discard prompt, (5) Keep 3 rogue offerings per shop, (6) No shop locking. UI: (1) Rogue card highlights in sidebar when triggered, (2) State shown in tooltip on tap/click, (3) Score breakdown order: smallest bonus first, largest last, (4) Turn modifiers always stack. NAMING: 'The [Title]' style, name + mechanics only (no flavor text). PRICING: Common $4, Uncommon $5, Rare $6.
notes: Alternatives considered: Tricks, Gambits, Knacks, Hustles. 'Rogues' won for brand tie-in and character feel. Interview findings from rl-45 incorporated.
closedReason: Implemented rogues system with all 14 rogues

title: New Boost: Lone Ranger
description: ROGUE: Lone Ranger - +6 points per word with exactly 1 vowel. RARITY: Common ($4). RULES: (1) Y counts as a vowel, (2) Blank tiles count as the letter they represent, (3) Triggers per qualifying word in multi-word plays (e.g., 3 one-vowel words = +18), (4) Applied after board multipliers but before multiplicative boosts. EXAMPLES: MYTH, LYNX, GLYPH, RHYTHM, CAT, STEP all qualify. SYNERGIES: No interaction with Vowel Power - both trigger independently (1-vowel word gets +6 Lone Ranger AND +1 Vowel Power). Rewards consonant-heavy tile management.

RULES: (1) Letters must be consecutive (BOOK's OO counts, POLO's O-O does not), (2) Triple+ letters count as non-overlapping pairs (AAA = 1 pair, AAAA = 2 pairs), (3) Triggers per qualifying word in multi-word plays, (4) Applied after board multipliers but before multiplicative boosts. UI: Highlight double letter pairs briefly during scoring animation. EXAMPLES: BOOK (+3), COFFEE (+6 for FF+EE), COMMITTEE (+9 for MM+TT+EE), BALLOON (+6 for LL+OO).

title: New Boost: High Value

UI: Show separate line in score breakdown - 'Buffed: +1, High Value: +1' not combined. UPGRADED TILES: Buffed (+1 score), Coin (+$1), Pink (+1 mult).
